values.title: Model time synchronization errors in sensor streams

content.raw: We currently have noise models for sensor outputs, but the timestamp is always perfect. @asymingt mentioned that real sensors have clock drift that should be modeled. There are different clock error models, such as a quartz oscillator vs. the global time used in GNSS measurements. Also, there can be multiple signals that share the same clock, such as the different axes of an inertial measurement unit.
content.html: We currently have noise models for sensor outputs, but the timestamp is always perfect. @asymingt mentioned that real sensors have clock drift that should be modeled. There are different clock error models, such as a quartz oscillator vs. the global time used in GNSS measurements. Also, there can be multiple signals that share the same clock, such as the different axes of an inertial measurement unit.

values.title: cppcheck errors: constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit

content.raw:
Several of our packages have cppcheck errors on recent OS versions, such as Ubuntu Wily that say Class 'X' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.

* [ign-math](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/IgnMathDefault/job/ignition_math-ci-default-wily-amd64/5/cppcheckResult/)
* [sdformat](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/SdformatDefault/job/sdformat-ci-default-wily-amd64/13/cppcheckResult/)

For example, it complains about the [Matrix3(const Quaternion<T> &_q)](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/27ac4eb7aab72d76600b8092d971fa63781d19e2/include/ignition/math/Matrix3.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Matrix3.hh-81) constructor.

What is the right thing to do about this?
content.html:
Several of our packages have cppcheck errors on recent OS versions, such as Ubuntu Wily that say Class 'X' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.

  • ign-math
  • sdformat

For example, it complains about the Matrix3(const Quaternion<T> &_q) constructor.

What is the right thing to do about this?
